channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'We have no choice': Indigenous guards take on cocaine gangs in Peru's Amazon
item.description: Deep in the Peruvian Amazon, the Kakataibo Indigenous Guard patrols their ancestral land armed with spears, machetes and a drone — risking their lives to keep cocaine producers out of the forest.
item.content:encoded:
Deep in the Peruvian Amazon, the Kakataibo Indigenous Guard patrols their ancestral land armed with spears, machetes and a drone — risking their lives to keep cocaine producers out of the forest.

(Image credit: Simeon Tegel for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Simeon Tegel

item.title: Iran's foreign minister says the nation is no longer enriching uranium at any site in the country
item.description: Iran's foreign minister on Sunday said that Tehran is no longer enriching uranium at any site in the country.
item.content:encoded:
Iran's foreign minister on Sunday said that Tehran is no longer enriching uranium at any site in the country.

(Image credit: Vahid Salemi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Hundreds of thousands rally in Manila against flood-control corruption scandal
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of Filipinos gathered Sunday in the capital in the largest rally so far to demand accountability for a flood-control corruption scandal that has implicated powerful members of Congress and top government officials.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of thousands of Filipinos gathered Sunday in the capital in the largest rally so far to demand accountability for a flood-control corruption scandal that has implicated powerful members of Congress and top government officials.

(Image credit: Mark Cristino)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How do you find peace after war? A combat vet and NPR reporter's bond points a way
item.description: NPR Veterans Correspondent Quil Lawrence interviewed Dave Carlson over 10 years, as the Iraq war vet went from war to incarceration to redemption on his long journey home.
item.content:encoded:
NPR Veterans Correspondent Quil Lawrence interviewed Dave Carlson over 10 years, as the Iraq war vet went from war to incarceration to redemption on his long journey home.

(Image credit: Caroline Yang for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: Trump issues two pardons related to Jan. 6 investigation
item.description: President Donald Trump has issued two pardons related to the investigation into the Jan. 6, 2021 riot, including for a woman convicted of threatening to shoot FBI agents.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump has issued two pardons related to the investigation into the Jan. 6, 2021 riot, including for a woman convicted of threatening to shoot FBI agents.

(Image credit: Julio Cortez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Disability rights activist and author Alice Wong dies at 51
item.description: The MacArthur "Genius" Award-winner was best known as the founder of the Disability Visibility Project, which highlights disabled people and disability culture through storytelling projects, social media and other channels.
item.content:encoded:
The MacArthur "Genius" Award-winner was best known as the founder of the Disability Visibility Project, which highlights disabled people and disability culture through storytelling projects, social media and other channels.

(Image credit: Allison Busch Photography)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: A red meat allergy caused by ticks killed a N.J. man. Here's what to know
item.description: Researchers say they believe they've documented the first known death from alpha-gal syndrome — a red meat allergy caused by tick bites.
item.content:encoded: Researchers say they believe they've documented the first known death from alpha-gal syndrome — a red meat allergy caused by tick bites.
item.dc:creator: Ava Pukatch

item.title: U.S. official says the 'table is being set' for possible military action against Venezuela
item.description: The country's largest aircraft carrier is expected to join thousands of service members in the northern Caribbean Sunday. But it's unclear if President Trump will use military force.
item.content:encoded:
The country's largest aircraft carrier is expected to join thousands of service members in the northern Caribbean Sunday. But it's unclear if President Trump will use military force.

(Image credit: Jaime Reina)
item.dc:creator: Laura Sullivan

item.title: Americana troubadour Todd Snider, alt-country singer-songwriter, dies at 59
item.description: Known for his cosmic-stoner songwriting and freewheeling tunes, Todd Snider's career spanned three decades.
item.content:encoded:
Known for his cosmic-stoner songwriting and freewheeling tunes, Todd Snider's career spanned three decades.

(Image credit: Mark Humphrey)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Judge indefinitely bars Trump from fining UC over alleged discrimination
item.description: The Trump administration demanded UCLA pay $1.2 billion to restore frozen research funding and ensure eligibility for future funding after accusing the school of allowing antisemitism on campus.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration demanded UCLA pay $1.2 billion to restore frozen research funding and ensure eligibility for future funding after accusing the school of allowing antisemitism on campus.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
